comments:
When you run the metadata generator application and point the source to an incorrect folder location (for instance the parent of your Eclipse install rather than the eclipse/ sub-directory), you get the following stack trace. It is hard to understand what the problem is from this stack.

 java.lang.IllegalStateException: fwJar cannot be set.
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxBundlesState.composeNewState(EquinoxBundlesState.java:406)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxBundlesState.composeNewState(EquinoxBundlesState.java:388)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxBundlesState.initialize(EquinoxBundlesState.java:831)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxBundlesState.<init>(EquinoxBundlesState.java:352)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxManipulatorImpl.load(EquinoxManipulatorImpl.java:335)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.metadata.generator.EclipseInstallGeneratorInfoProvider.initialize(EclipseInstallGeneratorInfoProvider.java:97)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.metadata.generator.EclipseInstallGeneratorInfoProvider.initialize(EclipseInstallGeneratorInfoProvider.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.prov.metadata.generator.EclipseGeneratorApplication.initializeFromArguments(EclipseGeneratorApplication.java:120)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.prov.metadata.generator.EclipseGeneratorApplication.start(EclipseGeneratorApplication.java:63)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:169)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:363)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:176)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:508)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:447)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1173)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1148)

Come on DJ, this is perfectly obvious. fwJar cannot be set, what more could you possibly need to know?

<g>
well, if we add a "-fwJar" command-line arg then *maybe* its ok... ;-)

The generator has since been fixed to ensure you are pointing at a valid location before it fires up the framework manipulator. I have also updated the framework admin exception message to be a bit more clear.
